item.title: Tips for Language Learning
item.description:
4 Important points

Points Actual actions Backing research/ideas
1. Acquire language through context Understand words in context (TV drama, Movies, Anime) (Stephen Krashen - learning theory) Improvement in language ability is only dependent on acquisition and not learning (e.g. Getting a joke). Processing is done in subconscious level, and is a natural, intuitive and subconscious process.
Watch with Foreign language subtitle Massive pattern recognition device in head, when you understand the meaning, brain will deconstruct meaning and grammar of context
2. Maximize input Continuous non-stop learning Two modes of thinking: 1. (Focus mode) Focus awareness to figure something out
Fill brain with as much foreign language context as possible 2. (Diffuse mode) Subconscious turning pattern recognition to piece out meaning in relax mode
3. Listen & Pronounce Shadowing (Mimic pronunciation and to hear natural language) (Yo Hamada - Shadowing) Shadowing is simply finding a clip of a native speaker speaking and mimicking everything about their speech - pacing, intonation, cadence, and most importantly of course
4. Make sure learning experience is positive Do not forget to reward yourself for your hard-work!

Recommended reading list

  • Principles and practice in second language acquisition (Stephen Krashen)
